course_description: Learn Python fundamentals for beginners, including syntax, data structures, and problem-solving through hands-on coding projects.
course_overview: This beginner-friendly course teaches core Python programming concepts such as variables, loops, functions, and file handling. Students will develop practical coding skills by building simple applications, debugging errors, and applying logic to solve problems. The curriculum balances theory with interactive exercises to prepare learners for intermediate programming challenges.
target_audience: Aspiring programmers, students, or professionals with no prior coding experience seeking to enter the field of software development.
learning_outcomes: Write and execute basic Python scripts using proper syntax
Apply fundamental data structures (lists, dictionaries, tuples) to organize information
Debug simple program errors using Python tools and techniques
Design algorithms to solve computational problems with control flow statements
Explain core programming concepts like variables, functions, and object-oriented basics
